item.title: Mayo Clinic: Jackson has bipolar depression
item.description: U.S. Rep. Jesse Jackson Jr., a Chicago Democrat who took a hushed medical leave two months ago, is being treated for bipolar disorder, the Mayo Clinic announced Monday.

text.content: U.S. Rep. Jesse Jackson Jr., a Chicago Democrat who took a hushed medical leave two months ago, is being treated for bipolar disorder, the Mayo Clinic announced Monday.

item.title: Texas A&M says shooter apprehended near campus
item.description: Texas A&M University says a shooter has been taken into custody near its campus in College Station.

item.title: Brent up on supply concern, economy worries curb rise
item.description: NEW YORK (Reuters) - Brent crude prices rose on Monday in choppy trade, hitting a three-month peak on concerns about North Sea supply and Middle East tensions, while fears about a slowing global economy checked gains. U.S. crude fell for a second straight session and Wall Street equities slipped after six days of gains, weighed down by data showing Japan's economy expanded in the second quarter at half the pace expected. A separate report showing Greece's economy contracted by 6.2 percent on an annual basis in the quarter also fanned concerns about economic growth. ...

text.content: NEW YORK (Reuters) - Brent crude prices rose on Monday in choppy trade, hitting a three-month peak on concerns about North Sea supply and Middle East tensions, while fears about a slowing global economy checked gains. U.S. crude fell for a second straight session and Wall Street equities slipped after six days of gains, weighed down by data showing Japan's economy expanded in the second quarter at half the pace expected. A separate report showing Greece's economy contracted by 6.2 percent on an annual basis in the quarter also fanned concerns about economic growth. ...

item.title: NBC halts Olympics for promotional monkeyshines
item.description: Viewers were incensed Sunday night when NBC cut away from the Olympics' conclusion to air a sitcom featuring a monkey.

text.content: Viewers were incensed Sunday night when NBC cut away from the Olympics' conclusion to air a sitcom featuring a monkey.

item.title: UNC reviewing possible post of Peppers' transcript
item.description: North Carolina is investigating how what appears to be a transcript for former football star Julius Peppers surfaced on the university's website.

item.title: Former Susan G. Komen executive has book deal
item.description: The former Susan G. Komen executive at the heart of the organization's clash with Planned Parenthood has a book deal.

text.content: The former Susan G. Komen executive at the heart of the organization's clash with Planned Parenthood has a book deal.

item.title: Google cutting 4,000 jobs at Motorola unit
item.description: Google Inc. is making its largest round of layoffs ever as it announced plans to cut about 4,000 jobs at Motorola Mobility just three months after buying the struggling cellphone pioneer.

text.content: Google Inc. is making its largest round of layoffs ever as it announced plans to cut about 4,000 jobs at Motorola Mobility just three months after buying the struggling cellphone pioneer.

item.title: Google buying Frommer's travel guides from Wiley
item.description: Google is buying the Frommer's brand of travel guides.

item.title: Motive unclear in Pa. wedding-day homicide
item.description: Why did a Pennsylvania bride allegedly stab her groom eight hours before the wedding?

item.title: Afghans met Taliban leader in Pakistan jail: officials
item.description: Afghan government representatives have held secret talks with a key member of the Taliban held in a Pakistani jail officials said Monday -- a move that could signal fresh hope for peace negotiations.

text.content: Afghan government representatives have held secret talks with a key member of the Taliban held in a Pakistani jail officials said Monday -- a move that could signal fresh hope for peace negotiations.

item.title: Oil boom brings scarcity of workers in small towns
item.description: The local prison is so short on guards that inmates can sometimes just walk away. A gas station barely has enough cashiers to keep up with the trucks filling the parking lot. And "help wanted" signs seem to hang from every restaurant and shop.

text.content: The local prison is so short on guards that inmates can sometimes just walk away. A gas station barely has enough cashiers to keep up with the trucks filling the parking lot. And "help wanted" signs seem to hang from every restaurant and shop.

item.title: Jets, Tebow get to work on wildcat package
item.description: Shhh! The New York Jets worked on the wildcat.

item.title: 'Onion Field' killer dies in California prison
item.description: Gregory Powell, who was convicted of killing a Los Angeles police officer during an infamous kidnapping that inspired the true crime book "The Onion Field," has died in prison at age 79, authorities said Monday.

text.content: Gregory Powell, who was convicted of killing a Los Angeles police officer during an infamous kidnapping that inspired the true crime book "The Onion Field," has died in prison at age 79, authorities said Monday.

item.title: Fidel Castro turns 86 behind closed doors
item.description: Cuba marked Fidel Castro's 86th birthday on Monday with congratulatory messages in state media but no planned appearance by the retired leader, who has faded from public view.

text.content: Cuba marked Fidel Castro's 86th birthday on Monday with congratulatory messages in state media but no planned appearance by the retired leader, who has faded from public view.

item.title: Egypt's Morsi empowered by army shakeup: media
item.description: Egypt's Islamist President Mohamed Morsi has emerged empowered by a "revolutionary" decision to dismiss his powerful defence minister and curb the military's sweeping powers, media said Monday.

text.content: Egypt's Islamist President Mohamed Morsi has emerged empowered by a "revolutionary" decision to dismiss his powerful defence minister and curb the military's sweeping powers, media said Monday.

item.title: Multiple people, officers, shot near Texas A&M University
item.description: (Reuters) - Multiple people, including law enforcement officers, were shot on Monday when a gunman opened fire near Texas A&M University, police in College Station, Texas, said. "We have multiple people who have been shot," police spokeswoman Rhonda Seaton told CNN, adding that law enforcement officers were among those. Police had the shooting suspect in custody, according to the university's website. The extent of victims' injuries was not immediately clear. ...

item.title: Russia slams new US sanctions on Iran
item.description: Russia's Foreign Ministry has harshly criticized new U.S. sanctions on Iran, calling them "undisguised blackmail" and warning that relations between Washington and Moscow will suffer if Russian companies are affected.

item.title: 3 found dead in burning car in Maine parking lot
item.description: Surveillance videos from a pair of businesses showed headlights from a couple of vehicles passing minutes before a car burned with three people inside early Monday, and one person was seen running away from the scene.

text.content: Surveillance videos from a pair of businesses showed headlights from a couple of vehicles passing minutes before a car burned with three people inside early Monday, and one person was seen running away from the scene.

item.title: Boehner gives high marks to Romney VP pick Ryan
item.description: House Speaker John Boehner (BAY'-nur) is comparing Republican Mitt Romney's choice of a running mate to John Kennedy, the Massachusetts Democrat who won the White House in 1960.

item.title: Ryan's Medicare plan would be tricky to pull off
item.description: The idea behind Paul Ryan's Medicare plan is to slow growing costs and keep the program more affordable for the long haul.

text.content: The idea behind Paul Ryan's Medicare plan is to slow growing costs and keep the program more affordable for the long haul.

item.title: Column: London done, so prepare for circus in Rio
item.description: IOC President Jacques Rogge still can't figure out what to call Usain Bolt, so here's hoping he gets another Olympics to sort it out. There's just something about his latest effort —"active performance legend" — that doesn't rise to a gold medal level.

item.title: Former NYC schools chief touts News Corp. venture
item.description: Former New York City schools chief Joel Klein left to run News Corp.'s education division but spent much of the past year defending boss Rupert Murdoch in the phone-hacking scandal that has rocked the British media.

text.content: Former New York City schools chief Joel Klein left to run News Corp.'s education division but spent much of the past year defending boss Rupert Murdoch in the phone-hacking scandal that has rocked the British media.

item.title: Comparisons only natural with McIlroy and Woods
item.description: The comparisons are inevitable. The incredible skill, the youth, even the red shirt on Sunday.

text.content: The comparisons are inevitable. The incredible skill, the youth, even the red shirt on Sunday.

item.title: Texas A&M: Active shooter on campus apprehended
item.description: Texas A&M University says a shooter has been taken into custody near its campus in College Station.

item.title: House files suit against Holder over gov't records
item.description: The Republican-run House on Monday asked a federal court to enforce a subpoena against Attorney General Eric Holder, demanding that he produce records on a bungled gun-tracking operation known as Operation Fast and Furious.

text.content: The Republican-run House on Monday asked a federal court to enforce a subpoena against Attorney General Eric Holder, demanding that he produce records on a bungled gun-tracking operation known as Operation Fast and Furious.

item.title: Wife of Md. man held in Pakistan urges release
item.description: The wife of a Maryland man abducted in Pakistan is pleading for his safe return on the one-year anniversary of his kidnapping, saying her husband is in poor health and is missed by grandchildren who ask for him every day.

text.content: The wife of a Maryland man abducted in Pakistan is pleading for his safe return on the one-year anniversary of his kidnapping, saying her husband is in poor health and is missed by grandchildren who ask for him every day.

item.title: Obama, Biden link GOP rivals to Congress
item.description: President Barack Obama and Joe Biden moved quickly Monday to link GOP rivals Mitt Romney and Paul Ryan to House Republicans who Democrats blame for causing gridlock in Washington and pressing policies to protect the wealthy.

text.content: President Barack Obama and Joe Biden moved quickly Monday to link GOP rivals Mitt Romney and Paul Ryan to House Republicans who Democrats blame for causing gridlock in Washington and pressing policies to protect the wealthy.

item.title: BBC: Olympic closing ceremony draws 26.3M viewers
item.description: The BBC said Monday that its live coverage of the Olympic closing ceremony was watched by 26.3 million people in the U.K., or more than 80 percent of the country's audience share.

item.title: Ford India recalls 111,000 cars over fault fears
item.description: US auto giant Ford's India unit said on Monday it was recalling at least 111,000 vehicles to check for potentially faulty parts that could cause breakdowns or fires.

text.content: US auto giant Ford's India unit said on Monday it was recalling at least 111,000 vehicles to check for potentially faulty parts that could cause breakdowns or fires.

item.title: House Republicans sue Attorney General Holder over gun probe
item.description: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - House Republicans filed a federal lawsuit on Monday against Attorney General Eric Holder, the country's top law enforcement official, seeking to obtain documents on a botched operation to link Arizona gun sales to Mexican drug cartels. The suit likely means the debate over the anti-gun-trafficking operation nicknamed "Fast and Furious" will go on for months, lasting through the U.S. elections on November 6 when Democratic President Barack Obama is likely to face Republican challenger Mitt Romney. ...

text.content: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - House Republicans filed a federal lawsuit on Monday against Attorney General Eric Holder, the country's top law enforcement official, seeking to obtain documents on a botched operation to link Arizona gun sales to Mexican drug cartels. The suit likely means the debate over the anti-gun-trafficking operation nicknamed "Fast and Furious" will go on for months, lasting through the U.S. elections on November 6 when Democratic President Barack Obama is likely to face Republican challenger Mitt Romney. ...

item.title: Biden calls Ryan policies 'irresponsible'
item.description: Vice President Joe Biden says Republicans Mitt Romney and Paul Ryan are decent men, but that they have fundamentally different values from him and President Barack Obama.

item.title: Iran government criticized over earthquake response
item.description: DUBAI (Reuters) - Iran's government faced criticism on Monday over its response to two earthquakes that killed 306 people, with complaints of a lack of tents and about President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad's decision to go ahead with an overseas trip. Although officials announced on Sunday, less than 24 hours after disaster struck, that search and rescue operations had finished and all survivors had been freed from the rubble, some locals expressed disbelief that authorities could have reached the most remote villages so soon. "I know the area well. ...

Although officials announced on Sunday, less than 24 hours after disaster struck, that search and rescue operations had finished and all survivors had been freed from the rubble, some locals expressed disbelief that authorities could have reached the most remote villages so soon. "I know the area well. ...

item.title: Pro-Romney group spends $10M on new ad campaign
item.description: A group supporting Mitt Romney is spending more than $10 million on a new television advertisement criticizing President Barack Obama's handling of the economy.

text.content: A group supporting Mitt Romney is spending more than $10 million on a new television advertisement criticizing President Barack Obama's handling of the economy.

item.title: World powers weigh emergency meeting on food prices
item.description: PARIS/LONDON (Reuters) - Leading members of the Group of 20 nations are prepared to trigger an emergency meeting to tackle soaring grain prices caused by the worst U.S. drought in more than half a century and poor crops from the Black Sea bread basket. France, the United States and G20 president Mexico will hold a conference call at the end of August to discuss whether an emergency international meeting is required, aiming to avoid a repeat of the food price spike that triggered riots in poorer countries in 2008. ...

text.content: PARIS/LONDON (Reuters) - Leading members of the Group of 20 nations are prepared to trigger an emergency meeting to tackle soaring grain prices caused by the worst U.S. drought in more than half a century and poor crops from the Black Sea bread basket. France, the United States and G20 president Mexico will hold a conference call at the end of August to discuss whether an emergency international meeting is required, aiming to avoid a repeat of the food price spike that triggered riots in poorer countries in 2008. ...

item.title: Google to cut 4,000 Motorola Mobility jobs, shares rise
item.description: (Reuters) - Google Inc will slash 20 percent of the workforce of Motorola Mobility in the Internet search giant's largest job cuts ever as it moves to make more smartphones and fewer simple mobiles. The news sent Google's shares up as much as 2 percent but analysts said it was unclear if the cuts were enough to restore the fortunes of Motorola, whose last hit was the Razr flip-phone launched eight years ago. ...

text.content: (Reuters) - Google Inc will slash 20 percent of the workforce of Motorola Mobility in the Internet search giant's largest job cuts ever as it moves to make more smartphones and fewer simple mobiles. The news sent Google's shares up as much as 2 percent but analysts said it was unclear if the cuts were enough to restore the fortunes of Motorola, whose last hit was the Razr flip-phone launched eight years ago. ...

item.title: Israel home to former Olympic legend
item.description: One of the world's most decorated Olympians is living quietly in Israel, a country that just wrapped up its participation in the world competition without a single medal.

text.content: One of the world's most decorated Olympians is living quietly in Israel, a country that just wrapped up its participation in the world competition without a single medal.

item.title: In Syria's Aleppo, hunger adds to suffering
item.description: ALEPPO, Syria (Reuters) - Syrians who have yet to flee the war in Aleppo are facing another problem that is growing more acute by the day: hunger. As the prices of what little is available soar, there are increasing signs of desperation among parents seeking to feed families in a city where fighting between President Bashar al-Assad's forces and rebels shows no sign of abating. At a makeshift hospital set up to treat the wounded, a doctor said some were seeking food rather than medicine. "People are coming to us now as a charity," said the doctor, speaking on condition of anonymity. ...

item.title: Syrian fighter jet crashes in flames, cause disputed
item.description: ALEPPO, Syria (Reuters) - A Syrian warplane crashed in flames in eastern Syria in disputed circumstances on Monday as President Bashar al-Assad's forces pursued their drive to quell rebels in Aleppo and elsewhere. State media said technical problems had caused the crash and a search was under way for the pilot who had ejected from the aircraft during a "regular training mission". ...

text.content: ALEPPO, Syria (Reuters) - A Syrian warplane crashed in flames in eastern Syria in disputed circumstances on Monday as President Bashar al-Assad's forces pursued their drive to quell rebels in Aleppo and elsewhere. State media said technical problems had caused the crash and a search was under way for the pilot who had ejected from the aircraft during a "regular training mission". ...

item.title: Belarus shot putter stripped of Olympic gold
item.description: Just hours after the close of the Olympics, a female shot putter from Belarus was stripped of her gold Monday in the first case of an athlete losing a medal for doping at the London Games.

text.content: Just hours after the close of the Olympics, a female shot putter from Belarus was stripped of her gold Monday in the first case of an athlete losing a medal for doping at the London Games.

item.title: Anti-immigrant party office in Greece firebombed
item.description: Authorities say arsonists have firebombed an Athens office of a far-right, anti-immigrant party, a day after the suspected racist murder of an Iraqi man in the Greek capital.
